com.itko.lisa.coordinator

Interface CoordinatorServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.coordinator.LabAware, com.itko.lisa.net.LisaServerObject, ServiceManagerSupport

    public interface CoordinatorServer
extends com.itko.lisa.net.LisaServerObject, ServiceManagerSupport, com.itko.lisa.coordinator.LabAware
    The CoordinatorServer interface provides the interface inheritance needed for custom Coordinator factories as well as the RMI indirection needed to generate remote CoordinatorServer stubs and skeletons.

    The CoordinatorServer's primary job is the construction of Coordinators for users that want to stage a test case. As such, most users will only need to use the single startTestCoordinator() method on this interface. All other methods are considered custom extensibility points and not useful for test loading and execution.

    At present, the CoordinatorServer buys you little more than the built-in RMI Activation framework with 2 exceptions: -handy collection of like Coordinators that enable you to entend or build additional software for tracking and reporting at this level in the architecture -monitoring of all Coordinators so that we don't have a bunch of orphaned RMI objects filling up the network.

      • startTestCoordinator

        TestCoordinator startTestCoordinator()
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                            TestDefException
        This method will construct a new TestCoordinator interface supporting object, the CoordinatorImpl in the default implementation, and give it the name requested. It is then up to you to initialize the TestCoordinator and start an actual test. Note that CoordinatorImpl will only live for a certain amount of time (5 minutes at this writing) without being initialized before it kills itself. This method is used to construct a coordinator that will run a single test. The TestCoordinator returned is a sub-interface of Coordinator, which is the shared interface for all running tests, individual tests or suites of tests.
        Returns:
        a TestCoordinator object that can be used to stage a test
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, TestCoordinator

      • startSuiteCoordinator

        SuiteCoordinator startSuiteCoordinator()
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                              TestDefException
        This method will construct a new SuiteCoordinator interface supporting object, the CoordinatorImpl in the default implementation, and give it the name requested. It is then up to you to initialize the Coordinator and start an actual test. This method is used to construct a coordinator that will run a test suite. The SuiteCoordinator returned is a sub-interface of Coordinator, which is the shared interface for all running tests, individual tests or suites of tests. Note that CoordinatorImpl will only live for a certain amount of time (5 minutes at this writing) without being initialized before it kills itself.
        Returns:
        a SuiteCoordinator object that can be used to stage a test
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, SuiteCoordinator

      • getAvailableCapacity

        int getAvailableCapacity()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        We use the stats of the process running to determine how many more coordinators can be created before exhausting the system's resources. This method returns -1 if there are no existing coordinators running b/c it has no basis to determine resource consumption. Also this method is only as accurate as the statement that the average resource consumption of what's already running is the same as that which will be added.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCoordinators

        java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Coordinator> getCoordinators()
                                                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a cloned copy of all the currently maintained Coordinators running in this CoordinatorServer. Useful for possibly generating adminstrative views of the CoordinatorServer. BE CAREFUL WITH IT. The returned collection all implement Coordinator, and currently will actually implement either SuiteCoordinator or TestCoordinator
        Returns:
        a Hashtable of Coordinators; all will implement com.itko.lisa.coordinator.Coordinator
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, TestCoordinator, SuiteCoordinator

      • getHistoryDBConnectInfo

        java.lang.String[] getHistoryDBConnectInfo()
                                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        The default configuraiton of LISA presumes that a reporting database is attached to each CoordinatorServer. This can be changed to almost any topology but is supported via a call to this method. If you need access to the database, assuming you have the proper driver and connections are allowed externally, you can call this to get the info you need. You get a 4-item array with the following: 0) the JDBC driver class, hope you have it! 1) the JDBC connect URL 2) the user, empty or null if not required 3) the pwd, empty or null if not required
        Returns:
        a 4-element String array as defined above
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
